meanings.definition: One of two or more atoms having the same number of neutrons but different numbers of protons.
meanings.sent1: An isotone is an atom with equal neutrons but varying protons.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study isotones to understand atomic structures better.
meanings.sent3: The isotone family reunion was a neutron-filled affair!
meanings.sent4: In the atomic world, isotones are like siblings with different personalities.
meanings.sent5: Imagine isotones as twins separated at birth, sharing a bond through neutrons.

meanings.definition: A chemical element that has the same number of neutrons as another element but a different number of protons.
meanings.sent1: When comparing elements, an isotone has matching neutrons but differing protons.
meanings.sent2: Isotones play a crucial role in the periodic table's complexity.
meanings.sent3: The isotone party had equal neutrons but a protonic mix-up!
meanings.sent4: Chemists see isotones as elements dancing to a different beat.
meanings.sent5: Picture isotones as musical notes in an element symphony, harmonizing with neutrons.
